lead_paragraph: Reading from a script for the second time in two weeks, Mr. Trump hammered away at familiar economic grievances in Pennsylvania, a state crucial to his election chances.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Monessen, Alexander Burns from New York, and Binyamin Appelbaum from Washington. Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI, ALEXANDER BURNS and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

headline.print_headline: Trump Takes Aim at Trade Pacts and ‘Globalism’
headline.main: Donald Trump Vows to Rip Up Trade Deals and Confront China

snippet: Reading from a script for the second time in two weeks, Mr. Trump hammered away at familiar economic grievances in Pennsylvania, a state crucial to his election chances.
abstract: Donald Trump, during speech in western Pennsylvania, promises to withdraw from international trade pacts like North American Free Trade Agreement and crack down on Chinese economic policies, drawing contrast between his nationalistic approach and Hillary Clinton's globalization-focused one; Trump's critique, which breaks with Republican orthodoxy, has much in common with that of small group of liberal economists.
